title: Deep Q-Networks for Accelerating the Training of Deep Neural Networks
abstract: In this paper, we show that by feeding the weights of a deep neural network (DNN) during training into a deep Q-network (DQN) as its states, this DQN can learn policies to accelerate the training of that DNN. The actions of the DQN modify different hyperparameters during training. Empirically, this acceleration leads to better generalization performance of the DNN.
histories: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error in the source-code (the epsilon configuration), which makes the results invalid
The DQN itself has too many hyperparameters

We choose to withdraw this paper. The DQN itself has too many hyperparameters, which makes it almost impossible to be applied to reasonably large datasets. In the later versions with SGDR experiments, the policies seem to be random actions only

We choose to withdraw this paper. The DQN itself has too many hyperparameters, which makes it almost impossible to be applied to reasonably large datasets. In the later versions (from v4) with SGDR experiments, it seems that the agent only performs random actions
